title: "Triptych in Walnuts"
creator: Gary L. Carlson
description: "Familiar paintings go nuts. Composition: wood, fabric, doll parts, walnuts, watercolor knock-offs, Velcro, pearl earring."
subject: Found-objects (Art)
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact lead archivist at MLK122@pitt.edu.
image_alt_text: A trio of famous paintings (Girl with a Pearl Earring, The Scream, and Mona Lisa) recreated with watercolors and walnut heads.

title: "All You Can Eat"
creator: Gary L. Carlson
description: "Gourmet dining awaits at the (far) corner table. Composition: black walnut, weather-stripping foam, forks, fabric, jackknife, measuring spoon, can top, PVC elbows (the shoes), cork, wood, posterboard."
subject: Found-objects (Art)
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact lead archivist at MLK122@pitt.edu.
image_alt_text: A walnut-headed figure waits eagerly for a meal in the corner of an all-you-can-eat diner, with a black-and-white checkered floor and half beige, half green walls.

title: "Quicksand"
creator: Gary L. Carlson
description: "Heads above the surface but sinking fast display terror or resignation in a theatrical venue. Found-object art is my true love and discarded black walnut shells are about as found-object as you can get. (Although I have a grand[child] who does very nice things with rocks.) Composition: walnuts (chewed by squirrels), cat litter, glue, Crown Royal bag, bottle cap, silent movie-type placard."
subject: Found-objects (Art)
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact lead archivist at MLK122@pitt.edu.
image_alt_text: Walnut heads peer just above the surface of quicksand inside a traditional theatre venue.

title: "Untitled (Enigmatic Figure)"
creator: Gary L. Carlson
description: "Enigmatic contemplation with a view. Composition: black walnut shell, reversed mink coat, calamine lotion bottle, rock. (A viewer once asked, 'Where did you get the rock?')"
subject: Found-objects (Art)
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact lead archivist at MLK122@pitt.edu.
image_alt_text: Enigmatic, walnut-headed figure stands contemplating the view from atop a rock.

title: "Judgment Day"
creator: Gary L. Carlson
description: "Most of us have either been frightened by or miffed off at the prospect of being judged by a bunch of people who donâ€™t really know us at all. Their institutions may be weighty with tradition and authority but are easily represented in paper, cardboard and walnuts. Composition: cardboard box, posterboard, wood, wood pegs, construction paper, PVC pipe, clock picture, black walnuts, popsicle sticks."
subject: Found-objects (Art)
rights: In Copyright - Educational Use Permitted. For more information, please contact lead archivist at MLK122@pitt.edu.
image_alt_text: Walnut-headed jurors wait in the shadowy inside of a white courthouse.
